Package com.example.thesix

Class AttendeeDB

java.lang.Object
com.example.thesix.AttendeeDB
public class AttendeeDB extends Object
AttendeeDB class facilitates interaction with a Firestore database to manage attendee information. Initializes a FirebaseFirestore instance (firestore)

  • Nested Class Summary

    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    AttendeeDB.FirestoreCallback
    Callback for firebase returning document ID after a successful Firestore operation.
    static interface 
    AttendeeDB.LocationCallback
    Callback for firebase location

  • Method Details

    • saveAttendeeInfo

      public void saveAttendeeInfo(String name, String contact, String homePage, String imagePath, AttendeeDB.FirestoreCallback callback)
      Saves attendee information to Firestore and uses a callback to return the document ID.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the attendee.
      contact - The contact number of the attendee.
      homePage - The home page of the attendee.
      imagePath - The profile image of the attendee.
      callback - The callback interface for returning the document ID.

    • saveAttendeeInfoNoPhoto

      public void saveAttendeeInfoNoPhoto(String name, String contact, String homePage, String imageData, String deviceID)
      Saves attendee information to Firestore without profile picture
      Parameters:
      name - name of attendee
      contact - contact of attendee
      homePage - homepage of attendee
      imageData - imageData of attendee
      deviceID - device id of attendee

    • updateAttendeeInfo

      public void updateAttendeeInfo(String documentId, String name, String contact, String homePage, String imagePath)
      Updates attendee information to Firestore
      Parameters:
      documentId - document id .to string()
      name - name of attendee
      contact - contact of attendee
      homePage - homepage of attendee
      imagePath - imageData of attendee

      public void removeProfileImage(String documentId)

      Parameters:
      documentId - path in which to delete
